aml.title: AML Policy
aml.intro: AML/CFT Policy — public version. Updated 9 October 2025.

items: **Company / Brand:** CODE DESIGN LTD / SoksLine.
**Jurisdiction:** United Kingdom (England & Wales).
**Company number:** 16676185.
**Registered office:** 61 Bridge Street, Kington, Herefordshire, HR5 3DJ, United Kingdom.
**Responsible person (MLRO/Compliance Officer):** Nicolae Buiuc (Director) — soksline@soksline.store.

sections.title: Policy refresh
paragraphs: This edition sets out the public-facing AML/CFT approach we apply, including oversight of crypto payments.

sections.title: 1) Purpose and approach
paragraphs: We deploy proportionate measures to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing without unnecessary bureaucracy.
We apply a risk-based approach (SDD/CDD/EDD): the lower the risk, the simpler the process.

items: **Statutes:** Money Laundering Regulations 2017 (as amended), Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (POCA), Terrorism Act 2000, Sanctions and Anti-Money Laundering Act 2018.
**Sanctions:** we follow OFSI listings (HMT Consolidated List).
**MLRO:** implements processes, trains the team, answers provider/regulator requests, files SARs with the NCA (UKFIU). Contact: Nicolae Buiuc — soksline@soksline.store.
**Operations & support:** follow checklists and escalate cases to the MLRO.

**L0 (baseline, no ID, low risk):**
- Small amounts and typical scenarios.
- Payments handled via a trusted crypto provider.
- On-chain risk assessment is completed before activating the service.
- Privacy coins are not allowed; we comply with sanctions controls.

**L1 (standard due diligence, CDD):**
- For higher limits or additional risk factors.
- Short identification (core details + document) with liveness/face match if needed.

**L2 (enhanced due diligence, EDD):**
- For larger amounts or elevated risk.
- We may request proof of address and/or source of funds; decisions are agreed with the MLRO.
**Mode:** we accept crypto payments through a trusted provider and do not process direct on-chain transfers without prior agreement.
**Process:** we review provider notifications, reconcile transactions, and complete on-chain risk assessments before activating services.
**Security:** we use secure communication channels and log key events.
**What we monitor:** serial refunds, mass logins via anonymizers linked to prohibited use, sudden spikes in IP volumes, attempts to bypass sanctions or geoblocks.
**Response:** pause, request short explanations or documents, escalate to the MLRO.
**SAR:** where we have reasonable suspicion, the MLRO files a SAR with the NCA (UKFIU) and requests a DAML if needed.
**Tipping-off:** we comply with the prohibition on alerting customers.

sections.title: 8) Data
paragraphs: We retain logs and materials related to checks and payments (including KYT reports) for up to 5 years.

sections.title: 9) Training
paragraphs: Introductory training plus a brief annual refresher.

items: **When we update:** annually or when requirements, products, or geographies change.
**Effective date:** 9 October 2025.

sections.title: How we apply measures
paragraphs: We follow a risk-based approach. Low amounts and low-risk profiles qualify for simplified measures; higher-risk cases require additional information. For crypto payments we rely on a trusted provider and perform on-chain risk assessments before activation.

sections.title: Disclaimer
paragraphs: This document is for information only and does not constitute legal advice. The company may adjust its AML/CFT measures based on legal requirements and risk assessments.

sections.title: Who we are
paragraphs: SoksLine (“we”, “us”, “our”) provides SOCKS/ISP proxy services.

sections.title: Data Controller
paragraphs:
[CONTROLLER_LEGAL_NAME], [Registration/Company No. if applicable]
[Registered Address]
(trading as “SoksLine”)
**Privacy contact:** support@soksline.store / soksline@soksline.store

items: **Account & Contact:** email, name (optional), country (if provided), support messages.
**Orders & Billing:** chosen plan, duration, invoices, payment status, crypto transaction details (e.g., transaction hash, paid amount/asset) as received from our payment processor.

**Network Service Data:** whitelist IPs, assigned endpoints, authentication attempts (success/failure), timestamps, usage totals/counters. We **do not** inspect or store your traffic content; we process only connection metadata required to run the service and prevent abuse.
**Anti-fraud & AML:** wallet-risk signals and screening results where required to accept payments and comply with law.
**Technical logs:** device/browser info, diagnostics, and error logs.

sections.title: Where we get data from
paragraphs: From you (account/order/support), from our payment processor (NOWPayments) and AML screening where applicable, and from our infrastructure (security/connection logs).

items: **Contract** — to register your account, deliver the proxy service, provide support, and issue invoices.
**Legal obligation** — to meet accounting, tax and AML requirements.
**Legitimate interests** — to secure our systems, combat fraud/abuse, and improve reliability (balanced against your rights).
**Consent** — only for optional communications not strictly necessary for the service (you can withdraw at any time).

sections.title: Cookies & tracking
paragraphs: We use only **strictly necessary** cookies/local storage for session, checkout/cart and language preferences. We do **not** use analytics or advertising trackers by default. If this changes, we will request consent and update this Policy.

items: Account & billing records: up to **6 years** (accounting/legal).
Connection/authentication metadata: up to **30 days** (security/abuse handling), unless we must preserve evidence longer.
AML/payment screening records: up to **5 years** or as required by applicable law.
We may keep minimal records where necessary to establish, exercise, or defend legal claims.

sections.title: Sharing & processors
paragraphs: We share data with trusted providers acting under written agreements:

items: **Crypto payments:** NOWPayments — processes payment and AML/KYC data pursuant to its own policies.
**Billing/Client portal:** WHMCS — provides client area/checkout and GDPR-aligned data export/erasure workflows.
**Upstream proxy supplier:** [UPSTREAM_PROVIDER_NAME] (if used) — service enablement and abuse prevention tooling.

paragraphs: We may disclose information if required by law or competent authority.

sections.title: International transfers
paragraphs: Some providers may be located outside the EEA/UK. For such transfers we rely on appropriate safeguards (e.g., EU **SCCs** and/or UK **IDTA**) and additional measures as needed.

sections.title: Your rights
paragraphs: You can request **access, rectification, erasure, restriction, portability**, and **object** to certain processing; you can withdraw consent at any time (for consent-based uses). To exercise any rights, contact us at support@soksline.store. You can also complain to your local data protection authority.

sections.title: Security
paragraphs: We use technical and organisational measures (encryption in transit, access controls, least-privilege, logging/monitoring). No method is 100% secure, but we continuously improve safeguards.

sections.title: Children
paragraphs: Our services are for users **18+** only.

sections.title: Automated decision-making
paragraphs: We do not make decisions producing legal or similarly significant effects solely by automated means.

sections.title: AML compliance
paragraphs: For details on AML screening and wallet-risk checks in the payment flow, see our [**/aml**](/aml) page.

sections.title: Changes
paragraphs: We’ll post updates on this page and revise the “Last updated” date. Material changes will be reasonably highlighted in advance.

sections.title: 1) Agreement
paragraphs: These Terms of Service (“Terms”) are a binding agreement between **[CONTROLLER_LEGAL_NAME]** (trading as “SoksLine”, “we”, “us”) and you (“Customer”, “you”). By creating an account, purchasing a plan, or using our services, you agree to these Terms, our **[Privacy Policy](/privacy)**, and our **[AML Policy](/aml)**.

sections.title: 2) Services
paragraphs: We provide access to SOCKS/ISP proxy services and related features (the “Services”). Plan features (e.g., endpoints, rotation, bandwidth, whitelists) are described on product pages or in the client area. We may update features to improve reliability or security.

sections.title: 3) Eligibility
paragraphs: You must be **18+** and legally capable of entering into contracts. You may not use the Services if prohibited by applicable law or sanctions.

sections.title: 4) Account, Onboarding & AML/KYC
paragraphs: You are responsible for your account security and all activity under it. We may conduct AML/KYC checks per our **/aml** (including tiered onboarding such as L0–L2) and may refuse, suspend, or limit service where risk is identified or information is incomplete/incorrect.

sections.title: 5) Orders, Activation & Delivery
paragraphs: Orders are provisioned after we confirm payment. For crypto payments (via NOWPayments), activation may occur after sufficient on-chain confirmations. Delivery is digital; no shipping of physical goods.

sections.title: 6) Billing, Prices & Taxes
paragraphs: Prices are shown before purchase. Unless stated otherwise, all fees are **prepaid** and **non-refundable** except as provided in Section 8. You are responsible for applicable taxes. We may change prices/product tiers prospectively; existing active terms remain until the end of the current paid period.
**Billing/Client portal:** WHMCS provides ordering, invoices, and self-service options.
**Payments:** crypto-only via NOWPayments. We do **not** store card details.

sections.title: 7) Term, Renewal & Cancellation
paragraphs: Plans run for the selected term (e.g., monthly). **Auto-renew is OFF by default.** You can renew manually in the client area. If you enable auto-renew (where available), you authorize recurring charges; you can disable it any time before renewal. You may cancel at any time in the client area; cancellation takes effect at the end of the current paid term.

sections.title: 8) Refunds & Chargebacks
paragraphs: Because the Services are digital and abuse-sensitive, **refunds are generally not provided**. We may consider a refund or service credit **only if** (a) the ordered plan was not delivered (no endpoints/credentials issued) within a reasonable time after payment confirmation, or (b) extended platform-level unavailability is verified under Section 12 (SLA/Credits). Crypto transactions are irreversible; where a refund is granted, it is typically via **service credit** at our discretion. Any chargeback is a material breach and may result in suspension and fees.

sections.title: 9) Acceptable Use Policy (AUP)
paragraphs: Prohibited uses include (non-exhaustive): spam/open-relay; DDoS/DoS, scanning, intrusion, brute force, credential stuffing; botnets/malware/exploit kits/ransomware/phishing; carding, payment fraud, money laundering, marketplace/ticketing fraud, identity theft; unauthorized access to third-party services/data or unlawful circumvention of technical restrictions; illegal content (incl. CSAM, extremist); IP infringement. You must have a **lawful basis and permission** to access target systems/data (incl. scraping). We may throttle/filter/suspend traffic reasonably believed to violate this AUP.

sections.title: 10) IP Addresses & Network Behavior
paragraphs: Allocated IPs/endpoints are **leased** and may be reassigned. Geolocation/ASN is approximate. Target-site blocks, CAPTCHAs, or reputation issues can occur and are **your responsibility** unless caused by a verified platform-level incident. Configure authentication securely and rotate endpoints only as permitted by your plan.

sections.title: 11) Fair Use, Limits & Abuse Handling
paragraphs: We may enforce fair-use (concurrency, rate, bandwidth) to protect platform stability; see product pages or client area for current limits. We may temporarily block or rate-limit abusive patterns and will notify you where feasible.

sections.title: 12) Availability, Maintenance & Credits (SLA)
paragraphs: We aim for high availability of core services, excluding scheduled maintenance and events outside our reasonable control (incl. upstream/provider faults, target-site countermeasures, force majeure). If monthly platform-level availability materially drops below our targets (if published), your sole remedy is a **service credit** proportionate to the impact, requested within 30 days. Credits don’t apply to target bans, per-IP reputation, or your misuse.

sections.title: 13) Suspension & Termination
paragraphs: We may suspend/terminate immediately for AUP/law violations, non-payment, risk/harm, or authority requests. On termination for your breach, fees are not refunded. We may retain records as required by law and our **/privacy**/**/aml**.

sections.title: 14) Third-Party Services
paragraphs: The Services rely on third parties (e.g., payment processor, upstream proxy provider). We are not responsible for third-party terms or changes outside our control.
**Upstream provider:** [UPSTREAM_PROVIDER_NAME, if used].

sections.title: 15) Warranties & Disclaimers
paragraphs: THE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED **“AS IS”** AND **“AS AVAILABLE.”** WE DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW.

sections.title: 16) Limitation of Liability
paragraphs: TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE ARE NOT LIABLE FOR INDIRECT/INCIDENTAL/SPECIAL/CONSEQUENTIAL/PUNITIVE DAMAGES OR LOST PROFITS/REVENUE/GOODWILL. OUR TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY WILL NOT EXCEED **THE FEES YOU PAID FOR THE SERVICES IN THE THREE (3) MONTHS** PRECEDING THE EVENT.

sections.title: 17) Indemnification
paragraphs: You will defend, indemnify, and hold us (and affiliates/staff/providers) harmless from claims arising out of your use, your content, or your breach of these Terms or law.

sections.title: 18) Privacy & Data Protection
paragraphs: Processing of personal data is described in our **[Privacy Policy](/privacy)**. We process network metadata for security, billing, and anti-abuse. We do not inspect your proxied content.

sections.title: 19) Changes to Services or Terms
paragraphs: We may modify the Services or these Terms. Material changes will be posted (and notified where appropriate). Continued use means acceptance.

sections.title: 20) Governing Law & Dispute Resolution
paragraphs: These Terms are governed by **[GOVERNING_LAW]**. Courts of **[VENUE]** have exclusive jurisdiction, except where mandatory consumer laws provide otherwise.

sections.title: 21) Miscellaneous
paragraphs: Severability; No waiver; Assignment (you need our consent; we may assign to an affiliate or in connection with a reorg/sale); Entire agreement.

sections.title: 22) Contact
paragraphs: Legal/support: **support@soksline.store** / **soksline@soksline.store**.

sections.title: Overview
paragraphs: Last updated: 09 October 2025

This Acceptable Use Policy ("Policy") governs how you may access and use the SoksLine residential proxy services operated by [CONTROLLER_LEGAL_NAME] ("SoksLine", "we", "us"). It applies to every account, end user, and integration that connects to the service.

This Policy forms part of and must be read together with our [Terms of Service](/tos), [Privacy Notice](/privacy), and [AML & KYC Policy](/aml). If you disagree with any requirement you must not use the services.

We rely on network capacity supplied by [UPSTREAM_PROVIDER_NAME]. You are responsible for ensuring that your use of those upstream resources complies with both this Policy and any additional requirements the upstream provider may publish.

sections.title: Who must comply
paragraphs: This Policy binds:

items: Primary customers purchasing or testing SoksLine services.
Authorized users acting on behalf of a customer, including employees, contractors, and service providers.
Any downstream client or integration that routes traffic through a customer's SoksLine resources.

paragraphs: You must ensure that every person who gains access through your account is aware of and complies with this Policy.

sections.title: Permitted activities
paragraphs: SoksLine is designed for legitimate business use cases that respect applicable law, target terms, and data subject rights. Examples of acceptable purposes include:

items: Brand protection, digital due diligence, and fraud-prevention investigations carried out with appropriate authorization.
Price comparison, availability monitoring, advertising verification, and SEO research in compliance with target site rules.
Quality assurance, performance testing, and cybersecurity research that does not exploit or degrade third-party systems.
Other research or analytics projects that do not interfere with, harm, or deceive individuals, infrastructure, or platforms.

sections.title: Prohibited conduct
paragraphs: The following uses are strictly prohibited and may result in immediate suspension or termination:

items.text: **Illegal or harmful activity**: Engaging in or facilitating unlawful, fraudulent, or deceptive practices, including sanctions violations, money laundering, human trafficking, child sexual abuse material, or the distribution of controlled substances.

**Security abuse**: Launching or enabling denial-of-service attacks, botnets, credential stuffing, brute-force attempts, port scanning without consent, or distributing malware, spyware, or ransomware.

**Privacy violations**: Collecting, processing, or sharing personal data without a lawful basis; scraping or profiling sensitive categories of personal data; bypassing consent tools; or attempting to deanonymize individuals.
**Impersonation and deception**: Masquerading as another person or organization, generating misleading traffic, creating fake accounts, or using the services to spam, phish, or harvest credentials.
**Intellectual property infringement**: Circumventing technical protection measures, copying proprietary content at scale, or otherwise violating third-party intellectual property rights.

**Interference with platforms**: Degrading, disrupting, or exploiting target websites, applications, APIs, or networks; violating published rate limits or robots.txt directives; or reverse engineering systems without permission.
**High-risk or regulated uses**: Activities related to gambling, adult entertainment, weapons, or other regulated industries without appropriate licensing and written approval from SoksLine.
**Subverting compliance**: Attempting to conceal the origin of traffic to bypass anti-abuse controls, sanctions screening, know-your-customer obligations, or law-enforcement requirements.

sections.title: Customer responsibilities
paragraphs: You must maintain accurate account and contact information, implement appropriate security for any credentials we provide, and promptly update us if your ownership or control changes.

Upon request you must provide documentation demonstrating compliance with this Policy, including the nature of your use case, relevant client contracts, and any required regulatory approvals or consents.
If you become aware of a violation or suspected violation, you must immediately stop the offending activity, notify SoksLine, and cooperate with any investigation.

sections.title: Network integrity and monitoring
paragraphs: We may monitor traffic patterns, metadata, and abuse indicators to protect our infrastructure, [UPSTREAM_PROVIDER_NAME]'s resources, and affected third parties. Monitoring is limited to what is necessary to maintain service integrity and comply with law.

SoksLine may rate-limit, filter, or block traffic that threatens the stability of our network or upstream providers. We may also require you to implement technical controls, such as traffic throttling, IP whitelisting, or rotating identifiers.

sections.title: Compliance with law and third-party terms
paragraphs: You are solely responsible for ensuring that your use of the services complies with all applicable laws, regulations, court orders, and third-party contractual obligations in every relevant jurisdiction.
If a platform, website, or data source informs you that your activity is unauthorized or must stop, you must immediately cease the activity and notify SoksLine.

sections.title: Enforcement and remedies
paragraphs: We may suspend or terminate access, remove configurations, or refuse future service if you breach this Policy or create an undue risk to SoksLine, [UPSTREAM_PROVIDER_NAME], or others.
We may share relevant information with upstream providers, affected platforms, regulators, or law enforcement where legally required or where necessary to prevent harm.
You are liable for any losses, claims, penalties, or reasonable costs (including legal fees) arising from your or your end users' violation of this Policy.

sections.title: Changes to this Policy
paragraphs: We may update this Policy from time to time. Material changes will be posted at /aup with a revised "Last updated" date. Your continued use of the services after a change becomes effective constitutes acceptance of the updated Policy.

sections.title: Contact
paragraphs: For questions about this Policy or to report misuse, contact us at **support@soksline.store** or via your account manager.

refund.title: Refund Policy
refund.disclaimer: Template content for product staging. This is not legal advice.

sections.title: Eligibility
paragraphs: Refunds may be considered for unused bandwidth or objective service faults, at our discretion.

sections.title: Process
paragraphs: Contact support with your order ID and evidence. We aim to respond within a reasonable time.

sections.title: Non-refundable
paragraphs: Consumed bandwidth and violations of AUP/ToS are not eligible.

sections.title: Chargebacks
paragraphs: Unwarranted chargebacks may result in account suspension.
